item.title: Week 7 - Mean, Median, and Weighted Mean
item.description: Let us assume that we have following data set; 50, 80, 60, 90, 70 Mean The mean is the sum of all values in a data set divided by the number of values in the data set. \[ mean = \frac{50 + 80 + 60 + 90 + 70}{5} = 70 \] Q. What is the mean of these numbers? 10, 11, 21, 13, 20, 16 Answer

item.title: Week 8 - Measure for the spread of distributions
item.description: Let us assume that we have following data set; 50, 80, 60, 90, 70 Now, we want to talk about the spread of our data. There are som Range The range is one of the measures that captures the spread of the data, which can be calculated by subtracing the minimum of the data set from the maximum of the data set. \[ \begin{aligned} Range & = max(data) - min(data) \\ & = 90 - 50 = 40 \end{aligned} \]

item.title: Week 9 - 68-95-99.5 rules
Week 5 - Freq. table and Stem plot
Week 4(STAT:1010) - Describe what you have in your data
Week 3(STAT:1010) - Data type and errors
item.description: Problem 1 (Data types) Definitions: Qualitative data: values that can be placed into nonnumerical categories. Nominal level of measurement - No ranking! Ordianl level of measurement - It has ranking system! Quantitative data: values representing counts or measurments Countinuous data takes any value in a given interval. Discrete data can take on only particular, distinct values and not other values in between.

item.title: Statistics and Society (STAT:1010)
item.description: Welcome to my discussion section for STAT:1010. Issac (Sak) Lee Office location: 213 SH Office hour: Friday 2pm - 5pm Email: sak-lee@uiowa.edu Please put a tag STAT:1010 in front of your title when you email me. Attendance policy We have 13 weeks for this semester. You will get 3 free absences. Thus, your attendance will counts as 1 point and you will get 10 points in total from this discussion section.

item.title: Week 2(STAT:1010)
item.description: Problem 1 A large warehouse is flled with light bulbs. An electronics engineer wants to estimate the mean lifespan of these bulbs. To this end, 18 of the bulbs were randomly selected and the lifespan was measures; the mean lifespan of the 18 bulbs was 2550 hours. What is the population? What is the sample? What is the parameter? What is the sample statistics? Problem 2 In a survey of 400 randomly selected UI students, 30% of students said they like a chocolate ice cream.
